query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Ne l’ora che non può ’l calor dïurno 2 intepidar più ’l freddo de la luna, 3 vinto da terra, e talor da Saturno
4 —quando i geomanti lor Maggior Fortuna 5 veggiono in orïente, innanzi a l’alba, 6 surger per via che poco le sta bruna—,
7 mi venne in sogno una femmina balba, 8 ne li occhi guercia, e sovra i piè distorta, 9 con le man monche, e di colore scialba.
query.result:
**English:**
1 At the hour when the heat of the day cannot 2 warm the coldness of the moon any longer, 3 conquered by the earth, and sometimes by Saturn
4 —when geomancers see their Major Fortune 5 in the east, before dawn, 6 rising along a path that is slightly dark—,
7 a stammering woman came to me in a dream, 8 squinting in her eyes and twisted in her feet, 9 with mutilated hands and a pale complexion.
**Cornish:**
1 Yn termyn na alloes tommder an dedh 2 tommhegi moy an yenner an loor, 3 drehevys gans an nor ha Saturn whiles,
4 —pan welo an jeomantoryon aga Fortyn Meur 5 yn est, kyns an gwawr, 6 ow tos ow kul ow talleth bys rudh—,
7 deuth dhe'm yn hunros benyn balb, 8 ow skevens yn aga lagha ha kemmys ow troha, 9 ow dhewlyn tronk ha ow liw glas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Io la mirava; e come ’l sol conforta 11 le fredde membra che la notte aggrava, 12 così lo sguardo mio le facea scorta
13 la lingua, e poscia tutta la drizzava 14 in poco d’ora, e lo smarrito volto, 15 com’ amor vuol, così le colorava.
query.result:
**English:**
10 I looked at her; and as the sun comforts 11 the cold limbs that the night weighs down, 12 so my gaze made her tongue swift,
13 and then straightened her whole body 14 in a short time, and her lost color, 15 as love wills, returned to her face.
**Cornish:**
10 Yth omwelis; ha kepar ha’n howl a wraga 11 an esel oos ow teves an nos, 12 hemma hemma ow fakya an golon aga tavos
13 ha wosa hemma ow tosya aga hol korf, 14 yn skon termyn byghan, ha aga enep kollet, 15 kepar ha kar Amor, hemma hemma ow livya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 Poi ch’ell’ avea ’l parlar così disciolto, 17 cominciava a cantar sì, che con pena 18 da lei avrei mio intento rivolto.
query.result:
**English:**
16 After she had thus loosened her speech, 17 she began to sing so sweetly that with difficulty 18 I would have turned my attention away from her.
**Cornish:**
16 Wosa hemma ow tosya aga lavar kepar henna, 17 hemma a dhalleth kanna kepar henna, byttegen 18 owth omma trohya an golon aga entent.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 «Io son», cantava, «io son dolce serena, 20 che ’ marinari in mezzo mar dismago; 21 tanto son di piacere a sentir piena!
22 Io volsi Ulisse del suo cammin vago 23 al canto mio; e qual meco s’ausa, 24 rado sen parte; sì tutto l’appago!».
query.result:
**English:**
19 "I am," she sang, "I am the sweet siren 20 who bewilders sailors in the middle of the sea; 21 so full am I of pleasure to hear!
22 I turned Ulysses from his wandering course 23 with my song; and whoever dares to be with me, 24 rarely leaves me; so completely do I satisfy him!"
**Cornish:**
19 "My a vy," kanna, "my a vy an seren dhoalek, 20 a wraga an morworyon yn kres an mor; 21 kemmys a vy leun a lowena dhe glewes!
22 My a drohya Ulises a'y fordh vagas 23 dhe'm kanna; ha neb a wraga gansam, 24 kov a wraga yma; hemma hemma ow'n gorra!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Ancor non era sua bocca richiusa, 26 quand’ una donna apparve santa e presta 27 lunghesso me per far colei confusa.
query.result:
**English:**
25 Her mouth was not yet closed, 26 when a holy and ready woman appeared 27 beside me to confound her.
**Cornish:**
25 Nyns o aga geno kosel, 26 pan dheuth benyn sans ha prest 27 dhe'm dhe wul an wraga henna kovfus.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 «O Virgilio, Virgilio, chi è questa?», 29 fieramente dicea; ed el venìa 30 con li occhi fitti pur in quella onesta.
query.result:
**English:**
28 "O Virgil, Virgil, who is this?", 29 she said fiercely; and he came 30 with his eyes fixed only on that virtuous woman.
**Cornish:**
28 "O Virgili, Virgili, piw yw henna?", 29 hemma a leveris yn feers; ha henna a dheuth 30 gans aga lagha set yn unnik yn henna onest.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 L’altra prendea, e dinanzi l’apria 32 fendendo i drappi, e mostravami ’l ventre; 33 quel mi svegliò col puzzo che n’uscia.
query.result:
**English:**
31 The other seized her and in front of me 32 tore open her clothes, showing me her belly; 33 that woke me up with the stench that came from it.
**Cornish:**
31 An aral a'y kemeras, ha kynsam 32 ow torras an dillad, ha ow'm diskwedhas aga korf; 33 henna a'm dyskwedhas gans an sawor a dheuth dhyworth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Io mossi li occhi, e ’l buon maestro: «Almen tre 35 voci t’ho messe!», dicea, «Surgi e vieni; 36 troviam l’aperta per la qual tu entre».
query.result:
**English:**
34 I moved my eyes, and the good master: "At least three 35 times I have called you!", he said, "Get up and come; 36 let us find the opening through which you may enter".
**Cornish:**
34 My a wrug an lagha, ha'n mester da: "Tri 35 gweyth owth omma gelwys!", hemma a leveris, "Surj ha dos; 36 kavom an fordh apert dre wrussa dos mosya".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Sù mi levai, e tutti eran già pieni 38 de l’alto dì i giron del sacro monte, 39 e andavam col sol novo a le reni.
query.result:
**English:**
37 I got up, and already all the slopes 38 of the sacred mountain were filled with the high day, 39 and we walked with the new sun at our backs.
**Cornish:**
37 Y'm sevel, ha pub tra o an leun 38 gans an jydh ughel an menydh sans, 39 ha nyn o kerdhes gans an howl nowydh dhe'n kolon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Con l’ali aperte, che parean di cigno, 47 volseci in sù colui che sì parlonne 48 tra due pareti del duro macigno.
query.result:
**English:**
46 With wings outspread, that seemed like those of a swan, 47 he turned us upward, he who spoke thus 48 between two walls of hard rock.
**Cornish:**
46 Gansoesowlek, ow avellas ow alarch, 47 ev a droes ni dhesempyth ow a leveris 48 ynter dew voya an garrek kalet.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Mosse le penne poi e ventilonne, 50 ‘Qui lugent’ affermando esser beati, 51 ch’avran di consolar l’anime donne.
query.result:
**English:**
49 Then he moved his wings and fanned us, 50 declaring those who mourn to be blessed, 51 for they shall have the souls of the ladies to console them.
**Cornish:**
49 Ev a waynyas y eselyow ha’n ev a waynyas, 50 ow leveris ‘Qui lugent’ bos ow, 51 rag an enevow a wra dhesempys an arethow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 «Che hai che pur inver’ la terra guati?», 53 la guida mia incominciò a dirmi, 54 poco amendue da l’angel sormontati.
query.result:
**English:**
52 “What ails you that you keep gazing down at the earth?” 53 my guide began to say to me, 54 we two having been raised up a little by the angel.
**Cornish:**
52 “Pyth yw dhys, pyth yw dhys ow tos orth an nor?” 53 an arweydh vy a dhallath dhe leverel dhym, 54 ni dhew a veu drehevys gans an el.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 E io: «Con tanta sospeccion fa irmi 56 novella visïon ch’a sé mi piega, 57 sì ch’io non posso dal pensar partirmi».
query.result:
**English:**
55 And I: “With so much suspicion does a new 56 vision, which bends me to itself, make me firm, 57 that I cannot tear myself away from thinking about it.”
**Cornish:**
55 Ha my: “Gans kemmys sospicion a wra gwir ow 56 nowyth welas ow a wra dhymm ow plegel, 57 byttegyns yw dhymm ow tos owth an poes.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 «Vedesti», disse, «quell’antica strega 59 che sola sovr’ a noi omai si piagne; 60 vedesti come l’uom da lei si slega.
query.result:
**English:**
58 “You saw,” he said, “that ancient hag 59 who alone weeps over us now; 60 you saw how man unbinds himself from her.
**Cornish:**
58 “Th’y welas,” ev a leveris, “hen vragydh na, 59 ow owth onan a-ugh dheugh sempys ow kewsel; 60 th’y welas pyth yw dyn a wra ow tos owth.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 Bastiti, e batti a terra le calcagne; 62 li occhi rivolgi al logoro che gira 63 lo rege etterno con le rote magne».
query.result:
**English:**
61 Enough, and strike your heels against the ground; 62 turn your eyes to the snare that goes around, 63 the eternal king with his great wheels.
**Cornish:**
61 Bas ow tas, ha tas dhe’ dha alsow orth an nor; 62 tro dha lyga dhe’n logor ow a droel, 63 an myghtern byth ha’y rosow bras.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 Quale ’l falcon, che prima a’ pié si mira, 65 indi si volge al grido e si protende 66 per lo disio del pasto che là il tira,
67 tal mi fec’ io; e tal, quanto si fende 68 la roccia per dar via a chi va suso, 69 n’andai infin dove ’l cerchiar si prende.
query.result:
**English:**
64 Like the falcon, who first looks at his feet, 65 then turns to the call and stretches himself out 66 for the desire of the food that draws him there,
67 so did I; and so, as far as the rock is split 68 to give way to him who goes up, 69 I went until I reached the point where the encircling begins.
**Cornish:**
64 Dell yw’n alarch, ow a wel orth y alsow kyns, 65 ow a droel dhe’n galow ha’y estyn orth, 66 rag an dysyr an boes ow a wra y tyn,
67 hemma wra vy; ha hemma, kyns yw’n garrek 68 ow a wra fordh dhe’n neb a wra dhesempyth, 69 vy a eas dhe’n le mayth an kelk a wra kemeres.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 Com’ io nel quinto giro fui dischiuso, 71 vidi gente per esso che piangea, 72 giacendo a terra tutta volta in giuso.
query.result:
**English:**
70 As I was revealed in the fifth circle, 71 I saw people weeping through it, 72 lying on the ground, all turned face down.
**Cornish:**
70 Dell vy yn peswora kelk vy a veu diskudhys, 71 vy a welas pobel ow a veu ow kewsel, 72 ow kov dhe’n nor, oll ow tos orth an nor.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 ‘Adhaesit pavimento anima mea’ 74 sentia dir lor con sì alti sospiri, 75 che la parola a pena s’intendea.
query.result:
**English:**
73 “My soul cleaves to the pavement” 74 I heard them say with such deep sighs, 75 that the words were scarcely understood.
**Cornish:**
73 “‘Adhaesit pavimento anima mea’” 74 vy a glewas aga leverel gans hujerow kemmys, 75 byttegyns o an ger ow a veu komprehendys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 «O eletti di Dio, li cui soffriri 77 e giustizia e speranza fa men duri, 78 drizzate noi verso li alti saliri».
query.result:
**English:**
76 “O elect of God, whose suffering 77 both justice and hope make you endure, 78 direct us towards the high ascents.”
**Cornish:**
76 “O etholys Dew, aga soveryans 77 ha jystyans ha spyrans a wra aga kalet, 78 lemmyn ni dhesempyth dhe’n ughelow ughella.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 «Se voi venite dal giacer sicuri, 80 e volete trovar la via più tosto, 81 le vostre destre sien sempre di fori».
query.result:
**English:**
79 "If you come from the place of the secure dead, 80 and you want to find the quickest way, 81 always keep your right hands to the outside".**Cornish:**
79 "Mar keffrys a'dhyskansowdhysury, 80 ha'gasowdhyskansowdhynfordh, 81 gwitha'gan klew dhe dhew dhe'n fordh".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 Così pregò ’l poeta, e sì risposto 83 poco dinanzi a noi ne fu; per ch’io 84 nel parlare avvisai l’altro nascosto,
85 e volsi li occhi a li occhi al segnor mio: 86 ond’ elli m’assentì con lieto cenno 87 ciò che chiedea la vista del disio.
query.result:
**English:**
82 Thus the poet prayed, and thus was answered 83 a little ahead of us; so I 84 guessed from his speech that the other was hidden,
85 and I turned my eyes to the eyes of my lord: 86 whereupon he assented to me with a glad sign 87 to that which the sight of desire asked.
**Cornish:**
82 Henwys an bardh, ha henna an gowsavas 83 byghan kyns anodho genev; rag hemma 84 y'm gwelas an lavar an aral gudhys,
85 ha'm troas y'm lagha dhe lagha an arloedh vy: 86 ena'm gowsavas gans arwydh lowen 87 henna a vynna an golwg a'n dhisir.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 Poi ch’io potei di me fare a mio senno, 89 trassimi sovra quella creatura 90 le cui parole pria notar mi fenno,
91 dicendo: «Spirto in cui pianger matura 92 quel sanza ’l quale a Dio tornar non pòssi, 93 sosta un poco per me tua maggior cura.
query.result:
**English:**
88 Then, when I was able to act of my own accord, 89 I drew myself towards that creature 90 whose words had previously made me take note,
91 saying: "Spirit in whom weeping ripens 92 that without which you cannot return to God, 93 pause a little for me, your greater care.
**Cornish:**
88 Pan oen y'm gallos oberi a'm dhisir, 89 y'm tynnas war an keureth na, 90 an lavarow a wrug genef vyth nota,
91 ow leverel: "Eneval y'gawra gwylas 92 henna heb na'th nyns yw possybel dy dhro dhe Dhew, 93 sevel byghan ragof vyth brassa gorrek.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 Chi fosti e perché vòlti avete i dossi 95 al sù, mi dì, e se vuo’ ch’io t’impetri 96 cosa di là ond’ io vivendo mossi».
query.result:
**English:**
94 Who were you, and why have you turned your backs 95 to the sun, tell me, and if you want me to obtain for you 96 something from there where I moved while living".
**Cornish:**
94 Piu oos ha'gasow lemmyn an dhew dhe'n fordh 95 dhe'n howl, lever dhyn vy, ha mar eus owth ow 96 travia neppyth a'gasow lemmyn ow pesya".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 Ed elli a me: «Perché i nostri diretri 98 rivolga il cielo a sé, saprai; ma prima 99 scias quod ego fui successor Petri.
query.result:
**English:**
97 And he to me: "Why heaven turns our paths 98 towards itself, you will know; but first 99 know that I was the successor of Peter.
**Cornish:**
97 Ha henna dh'ytho: "Rag wosa'gan fordhow 98 an nef dhe'n fordh, tyso; mes kyns henna 99 marowdhys quod ego fui successor Petri.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 Intra Sïestri e Chiaveri s’adima 101 una fiumana bella, e del suo nome 102 lo titol del mio sangue fa sua cima.
query.result:
**English:**
100 Between Sestri and Chiavari flows 101 a beautiful river, and from its name 102 the title of my blood takes its peak.
**Cornish:**
100 Ynter Sestri ha Chiaveri yma 101 avonva brav, ha dhyworth y hanow 102 an titel a'm gwydh a wra y bennak.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 Un mese e poco più prova’ io come 104 pesa il gran manto a chi dal fango il guarda, 105 che piuma sembran tutte l’altre some.
query.result:
**English:**
103 A month and little more I experienced how 104 the great mantle weighs on him who looks at it from the mud, 105 for all other burdens seem like feathers.
**Cornish:**
103 Mis ha byghan moy provyas vy efan 104 pyw an mantell bras dhe'n neb a'n gwyl a'n fank, 105 rag pluv semlant oll an aremmow erel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 La mia conversïone, omè!, fu tarda; 107 ma, come fatto fui roman pastore, 108 così scopersi la vita bugiarda.
query.result:
**English:**
106 My conversion, alas!, was late; 107 but, as soon as I became the Roman shepherd, 108 I discovered the deceitful life.
**Cornish:**
106 An droyans vy, omè!, o veu tarde; 107 mes, pan veu vy gwruthyl an bescop roman, 108 hemma dell wrug vy an byw bugel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Vidi che lì non s’acquetava il core, 110 né più salir potiesi in quella vita; 111 per che di questa in me s’accese amore.
query.result:
**English:**
109 I saw that the heart was not at peace there, 110 nor could it rise any higher in that life; 111 therefore love for this life was kindled in me.
**Cornish:**
109 Y'm gwelas na veu an colon sothens, 110 na moy gallos sevel ughella y'n henna byw; 111 rag hemma karanteth karanteth an byw-ma ynof.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 Fino a quel punto misera e partita 113 da Dio anima fui, del tutto avara; 114 or, come vedi, qui ne son punita.
query.result:
**English:**
112 Up to that point I was a wretched soul, 113 separated from God, completely avaricious; 114 now, as you see, I am punished for it here.
**Cornish:**
112 Bys dhe'n poynt na veu vy eneval ha ranndir 113 dhyworth Dew, eneval avarus; 114 mes lemmyn, avel yth gwels, y'm punitas rag henna.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 Quel ch’avarizia fa, qui si dichiara 116 in purgazion de l’anime converse; 117 e nulla pena il monte ha più amara.
query.result:
**English:**
115 What avarice does is declared here 116 in the purgation of the conversing souls; 117 and no penalty on the mountain is more bitter.
**Cornish:**
115 An tra a wra avaritia a wra dyclarys 116 yn purjasyon a'n enevalow convers; 117 ha neb pena war an menydh moy amar.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Sì come l’occhio nostro non s’aderse 119 in alto, fisso a le cose terrene, 120 così giustizia qui a terra il merse.
query.result:
**English:**
118 Just as our eye did not raise itself 119 on high, fixed on earthly things, 120 so justice here on earth submerged it.
**Cornish:**
118 Dell yw an lagha ni a wra asergis 119 yn uhel, fisys dhe'n traowow tyryel, 120 dell yw justitia yma war an nor a'n mergis.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 Come avarizia spense a ciascun bene 122 lo nostro amore, onde operar perdési, 123 così giustizia qui stretti ne tene,
124 ne’ piedi e ne le man legati e presi; 125 e quanto fia piacer del giusto Sire, 126 tanto staremo immobili e distesi».
query.result:
**English:**
121 As avarice extinguished in each one the good 122 of our love, whence action was lost, 123 so justice here holds us tightly bound,
124 with our feet and hands tied and seized; 125 and as long as it shall please the just Lord, 126 so long shall we remain motionless and outstretched."
**Cornish:**
121 Dell dell avaritia a spenjis dhe bubonan pub 122 an cara ni, le mayth oberi a gollis, 123 dell yw justitia yma a'n keffris streyt,
124 yn ein treys ha'n dhewlagow kevys ha kemeris; 125 ha kyns pell vyth pleser an Arluth just, 126 kyns hira vyth ni diworth ha distansys."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 Io m’era inginocchiato e volea dire; 128 ma com’ io cominciai ed el s’accorse, 129 solo ascoltando, del mio reverire,
130 «Qual cagion», disse, «in giù così ti torse?».
query.result:
**English:**
127 I had knelt down and wanted to speak; 128 but as I began and he noticed, 129 just by listening, my reverence,
130 "What cause," he said, "bent you down so low?"
**Cornish:**
127 Yth oen oen genowghys ha'm mynnis leverel; 128 mes dell yth oen omma ha'n ef a ascorsis, 129 dre henna wul ankow, a'm reverens,
130 "Pyth achos," ef a leveris, "a'th torris dell vel?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
131 E io a lui: «Per vostra dignitate 132 mia coscïenza dritto mi rimorse».
133 «Drizza le gambe, lèvati sù, frate!», 134 rispuose; «non errar: conservo sono 135 teco e con li altri ad una podestate.
query.result:
**English:**
131 And I to him: "Because of your dignity 132 my conscience rightly pricked me."
133 "Straighten your legs, rise up, brother!" 134 he replied; "do not err: I am a guardian 135 with you and with the others in one authority.
**Cornish:**
131 Ha my dhe ef: "Rag an agas dignitas 132 ow cosciens a'm remorjis yn iredh."
133 "Drisa agas eskern, sevel orth, broder!" 134 ef a leveris; "na wra erri: my a wra conservor 135 gans ha gans an erel yn unn poestas."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 Se mai quel santo evangelico suono 137 che dice ‘Neque nubent’ intendesti, 138 ben puoi veder perch’ io così ragiono.
query.result:
**English:**
136 If ever you understood that holy Gospel sound 137 that says 'Nor shall they marry', 138 you can well see why I speak thus.
**Cornish:**
136 Mar nagas an sôn Evangel santel hynwys 137 ow leveris ‘Neque nubent’ a aswonsist, 138 ythoma gweles perag omma leverel dell vel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
139 Vattene omai: non vo’ che più t’arresti; 140 ché la tua stanza mio pianger disagia, 141 col qual maturo ciò che tu dicesti.
query.result:
**English:**
139 Go now: I do not want you to delay any longer; 140 for your presence makes my weeping painful, 141 with which I ripen what you have said.
**Cornish:**
139 Mos dha: nyns vo’ vyth moy arestya; 140 rag ow stans a wra ankow ow wethan anesow, 141 gans an hyn a wra my a wra matura an tra a leveris.
